meanings.definition: The state or quality of being far.
meanings.sent1: The farnesses of the mountains made them seem unreachable.
meanings.sent2: The farnesses between the two towns required a long journey.
meanings.sent3: The farnesses of the planets in the solar system amazed the young astronomer.
meanings.sent4: The farnesses of time seemed to stretch endlessly before her.
meanings.sent5: The farnesses of the ocean were both daunting and exciting to the young sailor.

meanings.sent1: She measured the farnesses between the trees in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The farnesses from the house to the park were easily covered on foot.
meanings.sent3: The farnesses between the two friends' houses made them appreciate their time together even more.
meanings.sent4: The farnesses between the stars in the sky seemed infinite on that clear night.
meanings.sent5: The farnesses between the islands in the archipelago created a sense of adventure for the travelers.

meanings.definition: The extent of separation or remoteness.
meanings.sent1: The farnesses between the siblings grew as they pursued different paths in life.
meanings.sent2: The farnesses of the desert made it a challenging place to navigate.
meanings.sent3: The farnesses between the rival teams added to the excitement of the match.

meanings.sent5: The farnesses of the forest from the village gave it an air of mystery and intrigue.
